verses.roman:
yathā bhramarikā-dṛṣṭyā
bhrāmyatīva mahīyate
citte kartari tatrātmā
kartevāhaṁ-dhiyā smṛtaḥ

synonyms: yathā—as; bhramarikā—because of whirling around; dṛṣṭyā—in one's vision; bhrāmyati—whirling; iva—as if; mahī—the ground; īyate—appears; citte—the mind; kartari—being the doer; tatra—there; ātmā—the self; kartā—the doer; iva—as if; aham-dhiyā—because of false ego; smṛtaḥ—is thought.
translation: Just as a person who is whirling around perceives the ground to be turning, one who is affected by false ego thinks himself the doer, when actually only his mind is acting.

purport.content: Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī gives a parallel idea: Although our happiness and distress are caused by our own interaction with the material qualities, we perceive the Lord to be their cause.
